messages.author: Evan Martin
messages.text: You handle rtl specially below, do you need it here?

messages.author: Evan Stade
messages.text:
On 2009/07/30 23:37:37, Evan Martin wrote:
> You handle rtl specially below, do you need it here?

no, we don't flip page favicons (they may be direction-sensitive, e.g. google.com's G)

messages.author: tony
messages.text:
On 2009/07/30 23:37:37, Evan Martin wrote:
> 80 cols

Done.

messages.author: tony
messages.text:
On 2009/07/30 23:45:56, Evan Stade wrote:
> why can't we use gtk_label_set_ellipsize

Wow, didn't know about it.  It's awesome and I removed a bunch of code with it.

messages.author: tony
messages.text:
On 2009/07/30 23:45:56, Evan Stade wrote:
> On 2009/07/30 23:37:37, Evan Martin wrote:
> > You handle rtl specially below, do you need it here?
> 
> no, we don't flip page favicons (they may be direction-sensitive, e.g.
> google.com's G)

But the comment points out we probably shouldn't flip the product icon below so I changed it to just GetNamedPixbuf.

messages.author: Evan Martin
messages.text: Maybe mention who owns the returned pointer?

messages.author: tony
messages.text:
On 2009/07/30 23:37:37, Evan Martin wrote:
> Maybe mention who owns the returned pointer?

Done.

messages.author: Evan Martin
messages.text: maybe mention this is changing how the title is elided (it seems pretty mysterious otherwise)

messages.author: tony
messages.text:
On 2009/07/30 23:37:37, Evan Martin wrote:
> maybe mention this is changing how the title is elided (it seems pretty

Removed because I don't need to do this manually anymore.
